author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Pattali Makkal Katchi (PMK) will move the Madras High Court seeking direction to the Puducherry Government to shift all liquor shops located on National Highways.

In a release, V. Rajasekaran, spokesperson of the PMK said the Supreme Court had directed all State Governments to remove or shift liquor shops located on the highways. However, the Tamil Nadu Government did not take steps to remove the shops following which the PMK moved the High Court seeking a direction to remove all liquor shops. Subsequently, the government shifted as many as 504 liquor shops located on the highways in Tamil Nadu.

Mr. Rajasekaran said the party had also submitted a memorandum to the Chief Secretary of Puducherry seeking shifting of all liquor shops.

Despite repeated reminders the government is going soft on liquor retailers, he said adding that the PMK will file a PIL in the High Court seeking a direction to the Puducherry government in this regard.
title: PMK to move court against liquor shops on highways
